intro: Astragalus pseudoroseus, commonly known as the roseleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, adding ornamental value to its natural environment.
